message_1: What is the enthalpy of vaporization of water if it takes 40 kJ of energy to vaporize 20 g of water at 100°C?
message_2:
To calculate the enthalpy of vaporization, we can use the formula:

Enthalpy of vaporization = Energy required to vaporize / Mass of water vaporized

Given that it takes 40 kJ of energy to vaporize 20 g of water at 100°C, we can plug these values into the formula:

Enthalpy of vaporization = 40 kJ / 20 g

Enthalpy of vaporization = 2 kJ/g

So, the enthalpy of vaporization of water at 100°C is 2 kJ/g.
